item.title: NodeJS is broken
item.description: I’m not here to only critisize NodeJS. In fact it is the framework we use at my work, and in a LOT of companies. It has served us well over the years in the browser, and after that, it has continued to help us on the server. Given the widespread knowledge of javascript, it’s understandable that many people also reach for it when implementing their backends. CPU JavaScript’s main disadvantage on the server is its single-threaded nature, which makes it difficult to fully utilize all the cores available.
